title: Deleted Messages showing up as read (old was Bug 1856993)
content:
The problem I had earlier with Thunderbird 115.5.2 and Charter/Spectrum iMap has gotten worse, it now happens time I log into the open folder regardless of the account or folder. If I compact, it just lessens the number of deleted or moved messages that reappear on its initial read of the inbox from the server. The messages that show up are marked as read and if I got to another account and then back, they disappear. If I stay within the same account, they stay regardless of the folder I go to, until I go to another account and back.

Compacting just minimizes what it sees, it does NOT cure the problem.
creator: gwestlun

title: Dark Reader not working on mozilla.org
content: Dark Reader works for all sites except for mozilla.org, I think these webpages are over-ridden by the Firefox browser? I saw a couple archived posts recommending global changes for all sites via Firefox -> Settings -> Language and Appearance -> Colors, or to install themes. Neither option would work. I don't want to override all sites to dark globally, that's way to much change, just let Dark Reader change just mozilla.org.
creator: Leland359

title: FF version 120.0.1 has double spaced lines again. Fix?
content:
New computer, Win 11 and FF 120.0.1 all fresh installed and updated with latest versions. The double line spacing in bookmarks and all other menus is back. There was a fix for ver. 89 with the css file trick, but that DOES NOT WORK with this version. All other options I've run across don't work either. Why do the Mozilla software engineers think it's a good idea to break their flagship application every few years? Rhetorical question, I know.

Does anyone have a user fix that actually works with this FF 120.0.1 version? Something an experienced user can do that is not a programmer. analyst or engineer? I've been using FF since it first came out to challenge Microsoft's IE. Late '90s? I'd like to keep using it but this is too annoying to tolerate.

If anyone can help with step by step instructions, I would be eternally grateful.
creator: doninwn
